column4: how do I use the alert command so that it doesn't show the command in the OSD?
are this message bold for you?
the command is bold and the message is regular
for example, if I execute `alert "hello world"`, the OSD appears with the text 'alert "hello world" \n hello world' (where \n is a line break)
the first line is bold and the second line is not bold
how to print manual about software-center?
it says root: could not initiate dbus
what are you trying to do?
hold on, i'll find something for you
type this command in a terminal: sudo apt-get remove --purge fglrx-kernel-source xorg-driver-fglrx fglrx-modaliases libamdxvba1
autoremove only removes the downloaded packages in  your apt cache directory and has no effect on installed packages. so you can clear it if you want, or if not, just leave it
